stories.text:
As a frontend developer coming up with a basic data structure (say an array) to store some data you receive from the backend is common sense. But do you need as a frontend developer to read / learn on data structures more than maybe how queues or how lists work?

Besides programmers that work on software such as search engines or software were either memory is very limited or speed is extremely important, what other programmer types do need to learn data structures.

Or maybe the better and easier to address question is: what programmers don’t NEED to learn about data structures?
stories.title: What type of programmers do need to learn data structures?
Capturing Text from Camera Using SwiftUI

stories.text: I recently got into game development and am wondering if there are any technical blogs (or aggregators like HN) worth following for interesting game development news.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some great game developer engineering blogs?

stories.text:
A couple I have looked into, are Solana, Cosmos, Agoric.

I am talking about interesting projects that are more than a means for value (money) transfer or a decentralized exchange.

I think infrastructure or some DeFi projects fall into “good projects”
stories.title: What are some good blockchain projects, not meme coins?
Fee – Execute ELF binaries without dropping any files on disk

stories.text:
I am looking for good free resources for the uninitiated who want to self-learning and afterwards teach financial modelling, forecasting and valuation of private companies (large and small).

Is this possible to do i.e. self-learn and then teach others what you have learned?
stories.title: Ask HN: Good free resources for self-learning and teaching Financial Modelling?
